data.name: Flagship IPA
data.description:
Our Flagship India Pale Ale is bigger and bolder than ever. This full-bodied, copper-colored ale is exceptionally refreshing with huge hop character and a malt base that gives it great complexity. 
A great beer for hopheads.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Upstream Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Derived from the Native American meaning of Omaha,  “upstream” or “against the current”, the Upstream Brewing  Company is just that—a restaurant different from the rest.

Since opening in 1996, the Upstream has been all about fresh—from the handcrafted beers to the locally grown produce to the lively atmosphere. Not to mention the friendly, knowledgeable staff. So stop in today, and find out why we’ve been named one of Omaha’s “Best” several years running.

breweries.name: Old Firehouse Brewery
breweries.description:
The dream all began a few years ago while microbrewery hopping in Asheville, North Carolina. The Wife and I were sitting at dinner enjoying some fabulous craft beer and when she made the ultimate statement to me: "You know, for as much as you love craft beer, you should make it for a living."

Thus the mission of the Old Firehouse Brewery was found:  To passionately brew fresh, hand-crafted beer by using only the finest ingredients possible.

Our motto is great beer, great friends and great fun.

data.name: Flawless Victory IPA
data.description: The IPA of choice for the unscathed and senselessly brutal champion on the go. Enjoy this beer while standing tall and defiant above the vanquished. Triumphant hop aroma and bitterness are balanced by bold malt creating a venerable IPA champion of the people.

breweries.name: Ithaca Beer Company
breweries.description:
Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.

Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.

data.name: Flight of Simcoe
data.description: A bitter yet balanced IPA that is aromatically pleasing due to the heavy amount of dry-hopping with Falconer’s Flight and Simcoe. The Falconer’s Flight provides the slight citrus aroma while the Simcoe compliments it with strong pine aroma.

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

data.name: Flight of the Falcon
data.description: American IPA.   Here you go, hopheads. This one's brewed with Falconer's Flight hops, a unique blend of hops known to lend grapefruity bitterness to American pales. Ours is balanced and not overly bitter, but incredibly juicy, with tropical notes of orange rind and pineapple juice. Clean-drinking with a resinous and piney linger.

breweries.name: Timeless Pints Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lakewood's first microbrewery! 

On Father's Day, several years ago, my son and I purchased a home brewing kit for my husband. As an Engineer and a lover of craft beer, he was excited to experiment with his own concoctions. Since his first trial run, he's produced multiple variety of stouts, ales, lagers and IPA's as well as very happy friends, family and neighbors. His love for the unique keeps him constantly in search of "new and different" ingredients and the hope of a perfect combination.

One hot July evening, some friends disclosed they were embarking on a new restaurant idea. They asked Chris (my husband) if he would brew the beer specifically for their new endeavor. The ABC frowns on beer sold without the proper licensing and selling from the kitchen counter is not a viable option. Thus a new venture began.

What was once a dream is now a reality and we can now bring our own craft beer to our local Lakewood/Long Beach community. You'll find us just behind the Long Beach Airport.

breweries.name: Tin Whiskers Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tin Whiskers is the perfect place to be for the beer nerds and non-nerds alike. We bring our electrical engineering backgrounds into our brewery from our beer names, listing our ingredients and aspects of the brewing process, branding, circuit board flight holders and how we create new beers. In the taproom we share the stage the beer is in with so everyone knows where the beer is at in its life cycle development. 

For the thirsty, we will have seasonal offerings, year-round beers, and prototyped small batch recipes at our taproom. Whether our beers are the creation from the brewing masterminds at Tin Whiskers, or a collaboration with a local homebrewer, we promise to always have something on tap that you’ll love.  Come in and enjoy a pint or a flight of our beers on our circuit board flight holders. You can enjoy our beers at our taproom, in numerous bars throughout the Twin Cities or at home with a growler or 22oz bomber.

Tin Whiskers Brewing Company has a home in St. Paul in the historic Rossmor building. Our neighborhood isn't quite downtown nor Lowertown. You can find us in our gorgeous space at 125 E 9th St, St. Paul, Minnesota, 55101.

breweries.description:
Welcome to Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant, where you'll find fine handcrafted beers, creative yet informal cuisine, and friendly, attentive service in a casual, upscale atmosphere.

We're passionate about producing distinctive, full-flavored handcrafted beers, accompanied by fresh–from–scratch New American cuisine in a comfortable, casual atmosphere. Our goal has always been to provide food and beer that is inspired, consistently crafted and presented by a knowledgeable and courteous service staff.

Our commitment to support the communities in which we do business goes to the heart of what differentiates Iron Hill from other restaurants. But it is because of you, our guests, that we have been able to make this all happen.

breweries.name: Catskill Brewery
breweries.description:
The Catskill Brewery is a new venture between an organic fruit nectar importer and the founder of Catskill Mountainkeeper.. The all new 5,300 square foot brewery and office complex brings the various talents together under one roof. The brewery consists of 3,500 square feet for production, including the brew house and milling room, 12 fermentation and conditioning vessels, a bottling line, conditioned storage, and a small tasting area, all in a vaulted, clerestory-lit space. The office portion will serve the clients’ other business needs, with the future expansion of the brewery into this space as a micro-distillery and event space, opening on a German-style beer garden. 

The business acumen and technical savvy of the partners are apparent in the branding power of the design and the strategic vision integrated into the plan. Their environmental advocacy is demonstrated by the low-impact systems selected: thermal-bridge free envelope design; natural day-lighting; stack effect ventilation; all-permeable site paving; green roofs; solar photovoltaics and solar hot water systems; ground source heat pumps for heating, cooling and refrigeration; and native plantings.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

breweries.name: Center of the Universe Brewing
breweries.description:
Center of the Universe Brewing Company (or COTU for short), will be opening on November 16th. COTU began back in 2009 when Chris Ray and his brother Phil began brewing beer in their houses. The hobby turned into an obsession, and the obsession has led them to open up a craft brewery in Ashland, Virginia. Located in the heart of Central Virginia, it is affectionately known as “The Center of the Universe”. COTU will be brewing an assortment of ales using only whole ingredients, while sticking to the traditional all-natural method of brewing beer.

The meaning of “Center of the Universe” is important to the founders of COTU. With so much emphasis today on globalization and the lack of corporate stewardship, COTU wanted to be a company that truly embraces the local community. “Center of the Universe,” to COTU, is taking pride in where you live and respecting the people with whom you interact. We believe it is our responsibility to understand and appreciate how our actions affect the community that supports us.

At Center of the Universe Brewing Company it all revolves around the beer and the people who enjoy it.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Cambridge Brewing Company
breweries.description: CBC blends a passion for fresh, flavorful beer and delicious, imaginative cuisine to create a one-of-a-kind dining experience for greater Boston. Since opening in 1989, CBC has been the destination for diners with adventurous palates and a thirst for both authentic flavors and unique interpretations of classic beer styles. To satisfy these appetites, CBC’s brewmaster and chef routinely collaborate on investigating beer-food pairings and ways in which beer—even brewing ingredients—can transform traditional dishes and inspire new ones. This eagerness to ask ourselves “what if?” has earned us a slew of accolades, a shelf full of awards and devoted customers who are always eager to try what CBC comes up with next.

breweries.name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.

In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

breweries.name: Barhop Brewing
breweries.description: Barhop Brewing: Like many native Californians, Tom struggled with the all the rain in the northwest until he figured out what to do with it: start fermenting it! And so Barhop Brewing was born. On brew days, you can hear Tom brewing to the tunes of Pearl Jam, Bob Marley, The Grateful Dead, Led Zepplin, and so on. Tom’s California beer-drinking youth provided him with a strong affinity for the pioneers of micro-brewing, back when Sierra Nevada, Pete’s Wicked, and Mendocino Brewing were small craft brewers. Decades of drinking beer – and specifically micro-brews – have contributed to Tom’s brewing pedigree. (Or so he says.) Currently he is a big fan of Elysian and Russian River Brewing, and these companies have influenced his brewing style which he calls “aggressive California-style ales, with a Northwest twist, using fresh Northwest ingredients”.

data.name: Focal Banger
data.description:
Focal Banger is an American India Pale Ale. We have a real love for IPAs here at Alchemist, and we strive to offer you the best hop experience that we possibly can. 

This beer is brewed using Citra and Mosaic hops and our favorite British malts. Truly an abundance of hoppy goodness...

Freshness and control have always been my main concern when it comes to our beer. We are committed to providing you with an unfiltered and unpasteurized hop experience.

breweries.name: Third Rail Beer
breweries.description:
Third Rail Beer is a New York City-based craft brewery, driven by a passion for the endless pursuit of quality, honoring brewing heritage, and pride in the culture and community of New York. We brew our beer using our recipes, techniques, and favorite ingredients on equipment lent to us by our brewery friends.

Third Rail beers offer sensory experiences that spark memorable moments and robust conversations, showcasing the wealth of variety and personality that comes from four simple ingredients. 

Look for us on draft at your favorite NYC beer bar, and keep an eye out for periodic limited bottled/canned releases.

breweries.name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
breweries.description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Fork in the Road
data.description: The first beer in Blank Slate's "Traveling IPA" series. Autumn is a time of change and mother nature is at a fork in the road as the bright summer gives way to fall's darker colors. This beer sits squarely at the fork where darker malts and brighter hops meet. Munich and CaraRed malts give it an amber color and bigger malt presence than a standard IPA. Generous amounts of Citra and Centennial hops remind you that it's still an "India" style beer nonetheless.

breweries.name: Blank Slate Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Blank Slate is one of the many new small craft breweries in the Cincinnati Ohio area. Launched in 2012 they are part of the growing renaissance of craft brewing in Cincinnati.

Blank Slate unlike many breweries, produce primarily seasonal brands. This means that many of the brands will be rotated several times throughout the year. This philosophy to forego the "flagship model" of beer branding and embrace the seasonal approach to beer brewing (and drinking) is a big part of the Blank Slate mantra.

breweries.name: Fullsteam Brewery
breweries.description:
Fullsteam is a Durham, North Carolina brewery inspired by the agricultural and culinary traditions of the South.

Our mission is to craft a distinctly Southern beer style using local farmed goods, heirloom grains, and Southern botanicals. Like what, you wonder? We're making beer with sweet potatoes, corn grits, summer basil, and malted barley house-smoked over hickory. Other successful "plow to pint" experiments to-date include beer brewed with scuppernong grapes, persimmon, paw paw, rhubarb and more. 

Ultimately, our vision is to craft a year-round, sustainable, scalable, and distinctly Southern beer brewed 100% with local ingredients. That's the quest. We're a long ways from realizing this vision, but we hope you enjoy the adventure as much as we expect to. Interested? Read more about Southern-style beer.

data.name: FOTO
data.description: Late hops, dry hops, hops, hops, and more hops create a power citrus aroma and flavor. We use a whopping 4# per keg to create a delicious explosion. data.foodPairings: With its intense citrus hop flavor, this is a great beer to pair with smoked BBQ ribs and spicy Indian dishes.  Create a great taste sensation sipping a FOTO while nibbling on sharp cheddar and strong blue cheeses.

breweries.name: Lucid Brewing
breweries.description:
In July 2010, over a craft beer at a local restaurant, Eric Biermann and Jon Messier had a Lucid thought – “Let’s throw away the ties and the corporate ladders.  Let’s start a craft beer brewery!”  That Clarity in Thinking, led to the successful launch of Lucid Brewing.

In June of 2011, with a year of planning already completed, they realized jumping headfirst into the brewery was the only way they could make their dream a reality.  They quit their day jobs.  

With that leap of faith – and a ton of support from many friends and family – they started building their brewery from the ground up.  Through the sweltering heat of the 2011 summer, many friends labored side by side with Jon and Eric.  They did it all, start to finish, from digging trenches to assembling the last tank.  So of course they needed a refreshing and light drink to quench their thirst while they toiled away.  They found just the right recipe and brewed their first beer – AIR.  A beer made to get the job done.  Its slight citrus aroma and flavor, lower ABV and crisp dry finish made this their favorite “go to” beer.  

By October the brewery was complete and cooking.  And in the spirit of the season, Eric and Jon gave thanks to the Brew gods when they made their first deliveries to their first three customers the week of Thanksgiving… in Jon’s car.  Lucid was on its way!

Always keeping an eye on the demand for high quality while quickly catching the craft beer lover’s attention, Lucid assembled a team of dedicated employees and introduced brews to quench their customers’ demands.   AIR, DYNO, FOTO and DUO, along with seasonal and small-batch brews, are quickly becoming Minnesota favorites at local bars and restaurants.  

Great success has followed them after throwing away the daily grind for the daily brew.

data.name: Four Seasons IPA
data.description:
We want to let you know that the paraphrased statement below was and is our intention. We will not be doing that as we wanted. We will instead be doing 2 styles and working into 4. We being new and not having enough distribution yet, were not able to rotate the beers like we wanted. (We will be making 4 different styles of IPA for the 4 seasons. India Pale Ale is a wonderful example of marriage.  Bitter Hops and Boasting Barley come together to make one of the most sought after ales of the Craft Beer masses. Bottle Conditioned and Refermented.

From now on we will do a Summer and Winter. Hey we tried and we will fulfill our quest to do 4.

breweries.name: Stoudts Brewery
breweries.description: Over 26 years, Stoudts Brewing Company has grown and evolved from a small brewery with limited draught distribution, to a packaging regional microbrewery with distribution in 17 different states, producing over 10,000 barrels a year. Even with the growth over the years, one thing has always remained constant, and that is the attention to detail that goes into every batch of handcrafted beer that is traditionally brewed, packaged and sold with passion by our small team of hardworking dedicated employees. A tradition that was started by Ed and Carol Stoudt who both continue to spread the gospel of craft beer!

breweries.name: Foxhole Brewhouse
breweries.description: After being introduced to a "dark" beer at our local bowling alley we were hooked. Our love of craft beer took off and soon that turned into homebreweing. Now that's were the fun began! Two plus years of obsessive homebrewing (which is the only way Ryan works when he has a idea in his head) to a drive to learn about professional brewing brings us to the point...Foxhole Brewhouse. Why Foxhole? Well, our last name means Fox in German and Liv in all her "slyness" thought our home was our foxhole. We got a few good laughs, threw a few homebrew parties and it stuck. There hasn't been a brewery in Willmar since 1899 and we think it's time to bring it back with fresh, local, handcrafted beer! Not the fizzy yellow stuff massed produced and stripped of all the wonderful flavors that are meant to be in there. I mean small batch, flavorful and aromatic beer. Variety too, there are so many amazing varieties of beer that can be crafted we get excited thinking about brewing them for everyone to taste. Damn I'm thirsty...time to get brewing...see you soon!

breweries.name: Seven Brides Brewery
breweries.description:
Silverton, Oregon has much to offer. Known for its beautiful landscape of Silver Falls State Park and home of the Oregon Garden, it is rich with color and flavor. The town is lined with antique and coffee shops, restaurants and murals, but no micro-breweries, until now.

Seven Brides Brewing is changing that!

Several years ago, three dads and two uncles would gather on a Saturday in one of their garages to master the art of home brew. Before long, the salesman of the group said, “You know, this is good enough to sell.” So the friends set out to do just that.

The name “Seven Brides” actually came from the dads’ kids. Between three of them, they have seven daughters. With the rising cost of wedding nuptials, the guys decided they needed to sell enough beer to pay for their daughters weddings. Each of the girls has a beer named after her.

Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.

data.name: Franklin’s Crossing India Pale Ale
data.description: Franklin’s Crossing India Pale Ale is brewed for the hop head. We use a generous amount of malted barley to support an abundant amount of hops. After fermentation we dry hop every batch. We put 10lbs of whole leaf Cascade hops in the fermenter and soak the hops for two weeks. The result is a beer that finishes neat and clean.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.
